page.title: 05Strip and Dairy Farming.
page.content: {STRIP FARMING.} Epworth and the surrounding area is one of the few places in Britain where strips of land from the medieval practice of strip farming can still be seen.In this system long,narrow strips of land were owned and cultivated by different people so land of differing quality around the village was shared out equally.In most areas these strips have been combined to make bigger fields though here some still remain. { DAIRY FARMING. Dairy farms are rare in our area,there being only two or three herds in our block.This is mainly because the land is more suited to arable farming which is more profitable.Many small farmers who kept a few cows have in recent years had to dispose of these due to hygiene regulations.
